name: TheAtlantic
text: "Backlashes appear as seemingly serial and discrete events—against the civil-rights movement in the 1960s, or the women’s movement in the ’70s, or the gay-rights movement in the ’90s. But this obscures an underlying continuity," @LarryGlickman writes. https://t.co/LnK3UaupA0

name: TheAtlantic
text: With varying lockdowns in place, and safety measures enacted by local communities, the Muslim holy month of Ramadan has been observed very differently around the world this year. From @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/KE9Nv3by39

name: TheAtlantic
text: Photos of the Week: Skiing in the French Alps, flooding in Michigan, drive-thru burlesque in Las Vegas, disinfecting streets in Buenos Aires, social distancing rings in Turkey, a fawn rescue in Germany, and much more—via @TheAtlPhoto. https://t.co/Kd1oNg68WE

name: TheAtlantic
text: We’re going to be wearing masks for a while, but they make social interactions hard. So some experts are suggesting we wear face shields instead, writes @olgakhazan: https://t.co/GY3EAnQ8Rm

name: TheAtlantic
text: Listen: On the latest episode of the "Social Distance" podcast, @jameshamblin and @katlwells ask infectious-disease expert Stephen Thomas to explain the medical and ethical issues involved in developing a new vaccine. https://t.co/MEIwLUQYJW

name: TheAtlantic
text:
Universities face a nightmare this fall. Plus: some advice for the class of 2020. The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy and @isabelfattal:
